description: UMD 2.1.0 is the 1st update of second Major release of UMD (Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release introduces support for Scientific Linux 6 and Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><br/><div>EMI Technology Provider:</div><div>Job Execution services:</div><div>CLUSTER 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Publication in Glue 2.0 format implemented<br></li><li>Possibility to map different queues to different clusters&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>CREAM 1.14.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Publication in Glue 2.0 format finalized<br></li><li>Bulk submission supported in CREAM CLI<br></li><li>Support for RFC proxies<br></li><li>In cluster mode possibility to map different queues to different clusters<br></li><li>Possibility to use EDGI connector<br></li><li>CreamCE publishes non-production state when job submission is disabled<br></li><li>CREAM DB names are now configurable. This allows the use of a single mysql server to host the databases of multiple CREAM CEs<br></li><li>Limiter script (glite_cream_load_monitor) now reads the thresholds from a configuration file (/etc/glite-ce-cream-utils/ glite_cream_load_monitor.conf)<br></li><li>Use of Axis2<br></li><li>External jars are not included in the CREAM war anymore. So in case of e.g. a voms-api-java update, it is not needed anymore to also update CREAM<br></li><li>Several configuration steps moved from yaim to package postinst scripts<br></li><li>Several bug fixes<br></li><li>Implemented changes are backward compatible with EMI-1</li></ul></div><div>CREAM-LSF 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6::</div><div><ul><li>Complete the implementation of GLUE2 LDIF rendering in the CREAM information providers. In particular, address the dynamic information retrieved from the underlying batch systems.&nbsp;<br></li><li>Now the LSF info provider allow - in a queue name and rpoblem with missing yaim check for batch system is now enabled. Also &nbsp;GlueCEStateFreeCPUs and GlueCEStateFreeJobSlots are not published anymore and GlueCEPolicyMaxCPUTime is solved.</li></ul></div><div>CREAM Torque 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>Glue2 support in the dynamic provider<br></li><li>Implemented changes are backward compatible with EMI-1</li></ul></div><div>TORQUE-WN 1.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div>Torque-server 1.0.0-2 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre; ">	</span>New release for SL6<br></li><li><span class="Apple-tab-span" style="white-space: pre; ">	</span>Maui packages redistributed from third-party repository</li></ul></div><div>UNICORE/X6 5.0.0 &nbsp;release in SL5, SL6 and Debian 6</div><div><ul><li>This release among others improved functionalities as the possibility of including / excluding files by special file in the base directory. Also it gets and improved error information about jobs from the batch system, transfer rate is published in file transfer properties and provides support for the EMIR registry.</li></ul></div><div>CREAM sub-components released in SL5 and SL6::&nbsp;</div><div><ul><li>BLAH 1.18.1: This updates of BLAH fixes a problem of the bupdater for LSF which can leave job in IDLE state due to a timestamp problem.<br></li></ul></div><div>EMI-WN 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This &nbsp;releases includes updates of the middleware clients of AMGA, dCache, GFAl/lcg_utils.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>gLExec-WN 1.1.1 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>New LCAS and LCMAPS plugins and new installation directories: /usr/lib(64)/lcas and /usr/lib(64)/lcmaps.</li></ul></div><div>Storage Management:</div><div>StoRM 1.10.0 &nbsp;released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This release includes some bug fixes and adds a new functionality to StoRM BackEnd: Check gridftp responsiveness during gridftp load balancing component.&nbsp;</li></ul></div><div>Information services:</div><div>&nbsp;BDII Top 1.0.2 released in SL5 and SL6</div><div>Attribute Authority:</div><div>UNICORE XUUDB 1.3.2 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:</div><div>Client Tools:</div><div>UNICORE Client6 v. 5.0.0 released in SL5, SL6 and Debian:</div><div><ul><li>With this release comes a new feature which allows running system tests.</li></ul></div><div>EMI-UI 2.0.0 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>In this release there are improved functionalities in the dcache client, dcap &amp; srm-client. Also now bulk submission is supported in the CREAM CLI and support for RFC proxies as been enabled.<br></li><li>Bug fixes- Also there are some important changes in the WMS client regarding the glite-wms-job-list-match, glite-wms-job-output, glite-wms-job-status and glite-wms-job-cancel commands.</li></ul></div><div>Job Scheduling:</div><div>Internal LB component:</div><div>&nbsp;EMI gsoap-gss 3.1.4 released in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This release fixes the issue that causes that every communication through GSI fails. This only affects when globus-gssapi-gsi &gt;= 10.6 (globus &gt;= 5.2.1) is used.</li></ul></div><br/><div>IGE Technology Provider:</div><div>Job Execution:</div><div>&nbsp;GLOBUS GRAM5 5.2.1 released in SL5:</div><div><ul><li>The Grid Resource Allocation and Management (GRAM5) component is used to locate, submit, monitor, and cancel jobs on Grid computing resources. It is the first release in UMD.<br></li></ul></div>
installationNotes: <div>All products in the UMD 2.0.0 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze).</div><br/><div>Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository: <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_2/">http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd_2/</a>.</div>
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in: <a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.1.0">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-2:UMD-2.1.0</a>
changeLog: <div>This update brings support for all products in Scientific both SL6 and SL5:</div><div><ul><li>EMI-UI 2.0.0, gLite CLUSTER 2.0.0, UNICORE Client6 5.0.0, UNICORE XUUDB 1.3.2, UNICORE/X6 5.0.0, CREAM LSF module 2.0.0, CREAM Torque module 2.0.0, CREAM 1.14.0,EMI-WN 2.0.0, TORQUE server config 1.0.0, TORQUE WN config 1.0.0, gLExec-wn 1.1.1, StoRM 1.10.0, BLAH 1.18.1, gLite-gsoap-gss 3.1.4, BDII top 1.0.2, Globus GRAM5 5.2.1</li></ul>This major release brings support for products in Debian 6:<br><ul><li>UNICORE Client6 5.0.0, UNICORE XUUDB 1.3.2, UNICORE/X6 5.0.0<br></li></ul></div><br/>

products.name: emi.bdii-top
products.description: Grid information systems are mission-critical components in today's production grid infrastructures. They provide detailed information about grid services which is needed for various different tasks. The EMI information system has a hierarchical structure of three levels. The fundamental building block used in this hierarchy is the Berkley Database Information Index (BDII). Although the BDII has additional complexity, it can be visualized as an LDAP database. The resource level BDII is usually co-located with the grid service and provides information about that service. Each grid site runs a site level BDII. This aggregates the information from all the resource level BDIIs running at that site. The top level BDII aggregates all the information from all the site level BDIIs and hence contains information about all grid services. There are multiple instances of the top level BDII in order to provide a fault tolerant, load balanced service. The information system clients query a top level BDII to find the information that they require.
products.releaseNotes:
Update FCR mechanism to work with the new SAM interface.



Fixed wrong location of top-urls.conf file.



Randomise glite-info-update-endpoints cron job.



BDII top now depends on emi-resource-information-service.
products.changeLog:
Update FCR mechanism to work with the new SAM interface.



Fixed wrong location of top-urls.conf file.



Randomise glite-info-update-endpoints cron job.



BDII top now depends on emi-resource-information-service.

products.name: emi.blah
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.



CREAM exposes a web service interface.
products.releaseNotes:
This release fixes a major bug:

Due to a timestamp problem bupdater for LSF can leave job in IDLE state.

and several minor issues
products.changeLog:
This release fixes a major bug:

Due to a timestamp problem bupdater for LSF can leave job in IDLE state.

products.name: emi.gsoap-gss
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.



CREAM exposes a web service interface.
products.releaseNotes: This is a bugfix release of GSS/gSOAP plugin, fixing buffer under-run during setting proxy filename. GSS module should be updated when globus-gssapi-gsi >= 10.6 (globus >= 5.2.1) is used.
products.changeLog: This is a bugfix release of GSS/gSOAP plugin, fixing buffer under-run during setting proxy filename. GSS module should be updated when globus-gssapi-gsi >= 10.6 (globus >= 5.2.1) is used.

products.name: emi.storm
products.description:
StoRM (STOrage Resource Manager) is a:



    light

    scalable

    flexible

    high-performance

    file system independent



storage manager service (SRM) for generic disk based storage system, compliant with the standard SRM interface version 2.2. StoRM provides data management capabilities in a Grid environment to share, access and transfer data among heterogeneous and geographically distributed data centres.In particular, StoRM works on each POSIX filesystems (ext3, ext4, xfs, basically on everything than can be mounted on a Linux machine) but it also brings in Grid the advantages of high performance storage systems based on cluster file system ( such as GPFS from IBM or Lustre from Sun Microsystems ) supporting direct access (native POSIX I/O call) to shared files and directories, as well as other standard Grid access protocols. StoRM is adopted in the context of WLCG computational Grid framework.
products.releaseNotes:
StoRM-FrontEnd



What's new



    storm-frontend-server v1.9.0-10 fixed Bugs:

        Packaging Bug @270: removed read permission acl to others on configuration file



StoRM-BackEnd-Server

* What's new



    storm-backend-server v1.10.0-1 new Features:

        Feature @250: Check gridftp responsivness during gridftp load balancing

        Fixed bugs:

            Packaging Bug @270: removed read permission acl to others on configuration files

            Bug @267: path-authz.db is not recognized as a configuration file

            Bug @269: srmReserveSpace management produces spurious database entries

            Bug @277: The execution of srmGetSpaceMetadata on a valid token produce a null pointer exception

            Bug @278: Storage space database update time is not alway set correctly

            Bug @279: srmPrepareToPut returns the wrong error when a non existing space token is provided

            Bug @288: Service crashes on gpfs filesystems

            Bug @289: NamespaceFSvalidation check can fail if storage area root is specified as link



StoRM-GridHTTPs-Server

        Packaging Bug @270: removed read permission acl to others on configuration file



StoRM-GridHTTPs-Plugin

        Packaging Bug @270: removed read permission acl to others on configuration file

YAIM-STORM

    yaim-storm v4.2.2-1 fixed bugs:

        Bug @295: StoRM backend boot fails if FS is defined as XFS
